title: You JUMP, I JUMP Too
body_text:
AVAKIAN-SMALLS Confrontation from 128!
The gas tank was mighty full for this one as intense daredevils squared off in the ultimate battle for dodgeball surpremacy!
Flash Results by Game
Avakian: 1, 2, 3, 5, 6, 7, 8
Smalls: 4, 9
Their collective efforts never cease to amaze the eye. But allies they were not. The suicidal legend himself Rob Avakian showed not an ounce of remorse on this first of March. With consecutive rounds to his name, the idea of squashing his competition became a reality within just a few short hours.
His charismatic counterpart Joey Smalls put up one hell of an performance himself however. Though the conclusive score may tell a different story, make no mistake about it, battle cries from both armies could be heard a mile away.
Avakian defeated Smalls, 7 - 2
.
Moments & Stars
: the small fireworks display seen in a distance; Robert Brown's striptease between Games 1 and 2; Justin Wolf and Captain Joey Smalls's overall longevity
RECORDS
Attendance:
20
* (18 men, 2 women)
Notable Return: Rob Pellecchia (previous DB CXX)
- DODGEBALL 128 was both the 26th
Wet War
and 4th
Snow War
.
- In the main event, Rob Avakian easily defeated Joey Smalls by a score of 7 to 2. The win improved Avakian to 2-3-0. This was Smalls's first singles match-up since DODGEBALL 74 in late-January 2007. He is now 1-3-0.
*
Season 13 by the numbers
: DODGEBALL 124, DODGEBALL CXX7, and DODGEBALL 128 each had turnouts of 20. DODGEBALL 121, DODGEBALL 122, and DODGEBALL CXX-SIX featured 24 superstars. No 10-week season has ever "four-peated" on attendance. With DODGEBALL 129 and DODGEBALL C30 left, anything can happen.
~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~
DODGEBALL 129 on March 8
Young bucks, each making their long-awaited captains debut, collide in the first of this Season 13 double main event.
Rob Pellecchia
,
Bobby Vetrano
, one on one.
DODGEBALL C30 on March 15
They've done it all. The biggest confrontation of this 10-week season when feared southpaw
Kevin Megill
clashes with sniper-rifle
Chris Adams
! Plus, the first-ever
MoneyMaker Rimshot Contest
, Pete & Elda's Afterparty, and so much more are set in stone for this once-in-a-lifetime extravaganza. Special 6pm start is in effect.
body_html:
AVAKIAN-SMALLS Confrontation from 128!
The gas tank was mighty full for this one as intense daredevils squared off in the ultimate battle for dodgeball surpremacy!

Flash Results by Game
Avakian: 1, 2, 3, 5, 6, 7, 8
Smalls: 4, 9

Their collective efforts never cease to amaze the eye. But allies they were not. The suicidal legend himself Rob Avakian showed not an ounce of remorse on this first of March. With consecutive rounds to his name, the idea of squashing his competition became a reality within just a few short hours.

His charismatic counterpart Joey Smalls put up one hell of an performance himself however. Though the conclusive score may tell a different story, make no mistake about it, battle cries from both armies could be heard a mile away.

Avakian defeated Smalls, 7 - 2.

Moments & Stars: the small fireworks display seen in a distance; Robert Brown's striptease between Games 1 and 2; Justin Wolf and Captain Joey Smalls's overall longevity

RECORDS
Attendance: 20* (18 men, 2 women)
Notable Return: Rob Pellecchia (previous DB CXX)

- DODGEBALL 128 was both the 26th Wet War and 4th Snow War.
- In the main event, Rob Avakian easily defeated Joey Smalls by a score of 7 to 2. The win improved Avakian to 2-3-0. This was Smalls's first singles match-up since DODGEBALL 74 in late-January 2007. He is now 1-3-0.

*Season 13 by the numbers: DODGEBALL 124, DODGEBALL CXX7, and DODGEBALL 128 each had turnouts of 20. DODGEBALL 121, DODGEBALL 122, and DODGEBALL CXX-SIX featured 24 superstars. No 10-week season has ever "four-peated" on attendance. With DODGEBALL 129 and DODGEBALL C30 left, anything can happen.

~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~

DODGEBALL 129 on March 8
Young bucks, each making their long-awaited captains debut, collide in the first of this Season 13 double main event. Rob Pellecchia, Bobby Vetrano, one on one.

DODGEBALL C30 on March 15
They've done it all. The biggest confrontation of this 10-week season when feared southpaw Kevin Megill clashes with sniper-rifle Chris Adams! Plus, the first-ever MoneyMaker Rimshot Contest, Pete & Elda's Afterparty, and so much more are set in stone for this once-in-a-lifetime extravaganza. Special 6pm start is in effect.
